claim: The minimum age at first hospital visit in the cohort was 4 years.
reasoning: Using the formula SUBTRACT(YEAR(`First Date`), YEAR(Birthday)) as specified in the hint, the minimum age at first hospital visit is -10 overall, or 1 if excluding negative values (likely data errors). In no interpretation does the minimum equal 4 years as claimed.

content.text: I'll verify this claim by exploring the database schema and then computing the minimum age at first hospital visit.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE Examination
(
    ID                 INTEGER          null,
    `Examination Date` DATE         null,
    `aCL IgG`          REAL        null,
    `aCL IgM`          REAL        null,
    ANA                INTEGER          null,
    `ANA Pattern`      TEXT null,
    `aCL IgA`          INTEGER          null,
    Diagnosis          TEXT null,
    KCT                TEXT null,
    RVVT              TEXT null,
    LAC                TEXT null,
    Symptoms           TEXT null,
    Thrombosis         INTEGER          null,
    foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE Patient
(
    ID           INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    SEX          TEXT  null,
    Birthday     DATE          null,
    Description  DATE          null,
    `First Date` DATE          null,
    Admission    TEXT  null,
    Diagnosis    TEXT  null
);
CREATE TABLE Laboratory
(
    ID        INTEGER  default 0            not null,
    Date      DATE default '0000-00-00' not null,
    GOT       INTEGER                       null,
    GPT       INTEGER                        null,
    LDH       INTEGER                        null,
    ALP       INTEGER                        null,
    TP        REAL             null,
    ALB       REAL             null,
    UA        REAL             null,
    UN        INTEGER                       null,
    CRE       REAL             null,
    `T-BIL`   REAL             null,
    `T-CHO`   INTEGER                       null,
    TG        INTEGER                       null,
    CPK       INTEGER                       null,
    GLU       INTEGER                       null,
    WBC       REAL             null,
    RBC       REAL             null,
    HGB       REAL             null,
    HCT       REAL             null,
    PLT       INTEGER                       null,
    PT        REAL             null,
    APTT      INTEGER                       null,
    FG        REAL             null,
    PIC       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT2      INTEGER                       null,
    `U-PRO`   TEXT              null,
    IGG       INTEGER                       null,
    IGA       INTEGER                       null,
    IGM       INTEGER                       null,
    CRP       TEXT              null,
    RA        TEXT              null,
    RF        TEXT              null,
    C3        INTEGER                       null,
    C4        INTEGER                       null,
    RNP       TEXT              null,
    SM        TEXT              null,
    SC170     TEXT              null,
    SSA       TEXT              null,
    SSB       TEXT              null,
    CENTROMEA TEXT              null,
    DNA       TEXT              null,
    `DNA-II`  INTEGER                       null,
    primary key (ID, Date),
        foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: Now I can see the Patient table has `Birthday` and `First Date` columns. Per the hint, age = YEAR(`First Date`) - YEAR(Birthday). Let me compute the minimum age.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT MIN(STRFTIME('%Y', \`First Date\`) - STRFTIME('%Y', Birthday)) AS min_age FROM Patient WHERE \`First Date\` IS NOT NULL AND Birthday IS NOT NULL;"
input.description: Compute minimum age at first hospital visit

content.text: Interesting, there's a negative value. Let me investigate further.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT ID, Birthday, \`First Date\`, STRFTIME('%Y', \`First Date\`) - STRFTIME('%Y', Birthday) AS age FROM Patient WHERE \`First Date\` IS NOT NULL AND Birthday IS NOT NULL ORDER BY age ASC LIMIT 10;"

content.text:
There are negative ages (where First Date is before Birthday, which seems like data quality issues). But looking at the positive ages, the minimum positive age is 1 (or possibly we should look at the overall minimum). Let me check what the claim is really asking - it says "minimum age at first hospital visit... was 4 years."

Let me check if the minimum is indeed 4 when considering all records:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT MIN(STRFTIME('%Y', \`First Date\`) - STRFTIME('%Y', Birthday)) AS min_age FROM Patient WHERE \`First Date\` IS NOT NULL AND Birthday IS NOT NULL AND STRFTIME('%Y', \`First Date\`) - STRFTIME('%Y', Birthday) >= 0;"

content.text:
The minimum age (using the formula YEAR(`First Date`) - YEAR(Birthday)) is either -10 (overall) or 1 (excluding negative values). In neither case is it 4.

The claim states the minimum age at first hospital visit was 4 years. The data shows the minimum age is not 4 — it's either -10 (raw minimum) or 1 (minimum non-negative). Either way, the claim is contradicted.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "Using the formula SUBTRACT(YEAR(`First Date`), YEAR(Birthday)) as specified in the hint, the minimum age at first hospital visit is -10 overall, or 1 if excluding negative values (likely data errors). In no interpretation does the minimum equal 4 years as claimed."}
```
